page.title: 04FARMING - PETWORTH RURAL NE
page.content: Hens, mainly Rhode Island Reds, roam freely around most of the farms, and one farmer's wife tried selling her eggs at Petworth Market, expecting a good price for them as 'free range', said to be better quality than those battery produced. However, under the European Economic Community regulations her eggs were graded so small the price did not cover the cost of transport, so she gave up. Except for farms who produce their own milk, it is delivered, mostly on alternate days. Marshall's also provide their own meat. Newspapers are not delivered to any farm or house, the cost would be too high, but even in this remote district the Post is brought daily, and there are pillar boxes in some areas. Lowfold Farm has its own box at the end of the lane.
